page.title: 01Oystermouth - Today
page.content:
Around the beginning of this century Swansea was an important port. Many people came across the Bristol Channel to trade and made their homes in Mumbles. Their descendants, such as the Aces and Gammons are still to be found in the village today.
The fishing village has turned into a tourist attraction and the fishing boats have been replaced by yachts. Boarding Houses and small Hotels abound and friendly shops cater for the needs of the many visitors who come to enjoy the fantastic scenery and the pleasures of this small seaside resort.
By Robert Evans
